Tsabong has a range of shops, including a Barclays bank with foreign exchange, pharmacy and primary hospital. Tsabong is the capital of Kgalagadi District. In global terms though, itâ€™s a small village, with a population of about four thousand. It is situated on a massive pan. Historic buildings include the original wells, the first jail, District Commissioner and Station Commander's houses in the district (colonial era). There are a number of middle stone age sites in the area, but very little has been written about the history of the village. It also boasts an unsealed airstrip with the second oldest meteorological station in Botswana. Crime is negligible
From Gaborone: Get a taxi to the Main Bus Park. The Tsabong bus stop is near the south west corner. Buses leave at 08:00, 09:00 and 10:00 seven days a week. Journey time is 6-7 hours.
